title: Bacon Oatmeal Breakfast Cookies With Maple Glaze
ingredients: 1 ½ tablespoons water, or as needed
method: Step 1: Cook bacon in a large, deep skillet over medium-high heat, turning occasionally, until evenly browned, about 10 minutes. Drain on a paper towel-lined plate. When cool, chop bacon; set aside.

Step 2: Beat butter, white sugar, and brown sugar together in a large mixing bowl with an electric mixer on medium speed until fluffy, beat in egg and vanilla extract until thoroughly combined. Whisk flour, cinnamon, baking soda, and salt together in a separate bowl; stir into butter mixture. Gradually stir in bacon and oats, about 1/3 cup oats at a time. Cover dough with plastic wrap; refrigerate at least 1 hour.
Step 3: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Thoroughly grease baking sheets.
Step 4: Scoop about 1/3 cup dough per cookie and roll into balls; place at least 3 inches apart on the prepared baking sheets. Flatten balls slightly using a fork dipped in water.
Step 5: Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown with slightly browner edges, 10 to 12 minutes. Cool on baking sheets 3 to 5 minutes before transferring to wire racks to cool completely.

Step 6: Meanwhile, whisk confectioners' sugar, water, and maple syrup together in a bowl until smooth; let stand about 5 minutes to slightly thicken. Drizzle on tops of cookies; let stand about 20 minutes to set before storing.
